language.entry: Drag a hero from the roster here.
This skill cannot be used again during this Camp.
THIS DUNGEON IS TOO DIFFICULT FOR ME!
Increases ACC with ranged attacks until next Camp
Increases CRIT with ranged attacks until next Camp
Increases DMG vs large monsters until next Camp
Increases DMG with ranged attacks until next Camp
Use Camping skills to bolster your party's physical and mental health.
Party will not be surprised if ambushed
More likely to surprise monsters until next Camp
Less likely to be surprised until next Camp
Improve Scouting chance by %d%% until next Camp
Your save file appears to have been corrupted. We recommend backing up your save files to your Desktop or other location before continuing.
Your save file requires DLC that isn't installed. Estate cannot be loaded. Please reinstall DLC and try again.
Do you wish to tackle the increased challenge of New Game+? This mode features a campaign fail state, and tougher enemies.
Do you want to start a NewGame+ campaign?
The blood of the fallen has invigorated the Thing, accelerating its rebirth!
Too much time has passed - the creature has grown strong and is ready to take to the stars!
Enable Data Collection and Multiplayer (Not used in BR)
In order to access multiplayer features in The Butcher’s Circus DLC you must enable data collection. (Not used in BR)
See EULA on the Darkest Dungeon Steam store page for their privacy policy.
H - Contextual help for any screen
Q / E - Cycle to next hero while viewing character sheet
Q / E - Cycle to next hero while viewing character sheet
1/2/3/4/5 - Quick select a skill for the current hero
SPACE - take ALL when LOOT window is up
Click to dismiss hero word balloons.
Disable this option to improve performance.
These gameplay settings cannot be changed for a Stygian game.
3D perspective effect when switching between hero and monster turns
Enable controllers in addition to the keyboard.
Dead enemies leave corpses, which block combat positions.
Gameplay settings as intended to be played. Turning this OFF allows you to toggle the gameplay features below.
Stat penalties persist even after being healed off of Death's Door.
Show error messages for game errors. Useful for troubleshooting and bug reports.
Ensure more even long-term distribution of heroes in the Ferry.
Adjust how long hero word balloons show up.
This is what happens to carried trinkets when you have a total party wipe.
Dungeon map will auto-center on party when idle.
Collect anonymous usage data to help us make game adjustments.
Enemy crits multiply base damage, similar to players. If turned OFF, enemy crits just do max damage.
Whether heroes who have completed a Darkest Dungeon quest may re-enter that dungeon. Strict: may not enter. Permissive: may enter, but will be stressed out.
Show warnings related to embarking on a quest. This includes such things as not having much food or torches.
Show warnings when advancing from Quest Select to Provisioning phase. This includes such things as trinkets not being equipped, or other party warnings.
Combat retreats sometimes require multiple attempts to safely escape.
If enabled, active party members always appear at the top of the hero roster in town.
Heroes get {colour_start|stressNOT1}stressed{colour_end} and enemies can call reinforcements if you take too long to kill them.
Show text subtitles for the Narrator's voice-over.
Adjust the frequency of Town Events, which happen upon return from a quest.
We recommend leaving this option on for the most authentic experience. Still disable?
Restart the game for these changes to take effect.
We've enabled Steam Cloud saves. Your save files have moved to your Steam user directory.
You don't have enough room in inventory to take all. Make room or choose only what you can carry.
Your realm inventory is full. Sell or discard some trinkets to make room.
Clear the obstacle by hand. It will take considerable effort...
This item is needed for a Darkest Dungeon quest.
Curio Tag: {?curio_tag_chance}%+d%% chance of interacting with {?curio_tag}%s curios
One of your heroes is currently captured. If you retreat now, that hero will certainly be lost. Really retreat?
Are you sure you want to retreat? The heroes will suffer the stress of defeat...
The fiends are closing in and a random hero must give their life to ensure the others will escape from the Darkest Dungeon. Really abandon quest?
A hero must sacrifice themself to delay the bandits until help arrives. Really abandon quest?
One hero must be sacrificed to hold back the Brigand's advance. Really abandon quest?
Anger flows forth into action. Might is survival. The weak must fall.
Cast off, adrift, in a dark sea amongst jagged rocks.
Fear has overwhelmed the hero, whose every thought is now turned to self-preservation.
Two and two make three while six and seven break free.
Pain is pleasure to the Just, to the Willing, to the Surivor.
Wolves lie in wait behind every tree; diseases are in every meal; avarice behind every friend.
“I say let the world go to hell, but I should always have my tea.”
%s joined each other in a heroic demise. There were no survivors.
A shimmering likeness of your Ancestor! He wishes to speak...
The floor seems to pitch and buckle!
The Caretaker is currently enjoying this activity...
The Crier is currently enjoying this activity...
It's no use...this is all the light we are getting for now.
Can't use torches during an ambush!
Powerful spirits will wash the taste of maggots out of my mouth.
Your face and the drinks are all blending together, my liege!
A loveless embrace - what cruel irony!
Such pretty things, my pets, my pets...
Take my blood as you have taken my mind! Whoo-hahahaha!
One lash for each of you! No skin shall be left!
My very soul rests on this throw of the dice! Again!
I wager it all - all of it!
Succeed in your first assault on the Darkest Dungeon.
Succeed in your second assault on the Darkest Dungeon.
Succeed in your third assault on the Darkest Dungeon.
Complete the final Darkest Dungeon quest.
Successfully complete your first foray into the Ruins
Sometimes it's nice to find a quiet spot, that my dark musings go undisturbed.
Peace is acceptance. We are all but playthings of the Gods!
I pray, I beseech - GET ME AWAY FROM THIS PLACE!
Oh Light, burn my soul! Ha ha ha ha ha!
IS THIS YOUR FIRST ESTATE? The Crimson Court increases the complexity and pressure of the campaign. It is recommended for experienced players.
The Crimson Court: includes the Courtyard region and all associated quests, monsters, bosses, treasures, and storylines.
The Color of Madness DLC adds the new Farmstead region, which contains new quests, new monsters, and new treasures. Also activates four new District buildings in town.
The Districts system: upgrade your Hamlet by building all new structures in addition to the original buildings.
IS THIS YOUR FIRST ESTATE? The Crimson Court increases the complexity and pressure of the campaign. It is recommended for experienced players.
Aha - a full glass! Good news at last!
hic! My liver - as doomed as the Hamlet - hahah!
Feh - get gone and leave me to myself!
I...I wish only to lie here for a spell.
I lash the sorrow away! See it run red down the drain...
Open the scabs once more, for I am a shameful thing.
hic! Chance and fate - one and the same!
I bet the news is bad tomorrow - call it a hunch.
Gods and men. Gods are men. Gobs of men...hehehahahaa!
Quiet, damn you! It's so hard to nap with all this chanting!
hic! They pray with their bibles, while I pray with my flask!
Failure in the Darkest Dungeon has only strengthened the resolve of those left behind. ({colour_start|notable}x2 Resolve XP Bonus{colour_end} in the next quest.)
Success in the Darkest Dungeon has inspired all heroes in the Hamlet. {colour_start|notable}Stress removed!{colour_end}
fell to the hand of an ally.
fell to the hand of an ally.
fell to the hand of an ally.
fell to the hand of an ally!
fell to the hand of an ally.
fell to the hand of an ally.
fell to the hand of an ally.
bled out due to a wound inflicted by a fellow hero.
was boiled to death by the Hag.
died ensuring others could escape from the Darkest Dungeon.
fell to the hand of an ally.
had a heart attack due to unsustainable {colour_start|stressNOT1}stress{colour_end}.
collapsed permanently while clearing an obstacle.
fell to the hand of an ally.
fell to the hand of an ally.
fell to the hand of an ally.
died ensuring the Bandit raiders were delayed.
collapsed permanently while clearing an obstacle.
was boiled to death by the Hag.
was boiled to death by the Hag.
was careless and died from its own
expired when its attack was reflected back.
This version of Darkest Dungeon has been created specifically for demonstration purposes
[SHIFT-CLICK] on this item to discard it.
Your inventory is full. Discard items to make room.
This DLC cannot be disabled for this Estate.
(You may enable multiple DLCs at once for any Estate.)
{?hero_names}%s went to reclaim some of the Ancestor's most prized relics. ({?difficulty}%s {?length}%s)
{?hero_names}%s set off to reclaim Holy Relics buried deep in the ruined vaults of the ancestral home. ({?difficulty}%s {?length}%s)
{?hero_names}%s went to recover foodstuffs that the Swine have stolen and stashed in the Warrens. ({?difficulty}%s {?length}%s)
{?hero_names}%s embarked in search of vital medicines lost along the Old Road in the Weald. ({?difficulty}%s {?length}%s)
{?hero_names}%s set out to light the protective wards and drive off the Eldritch fish creatures. ({?difficulty}%s {?length}%s)
{?hero_names}%s went on a mission of reclamation in the Ruins, to restore holy altars in the name of Light. ({?difficulty}%s {?length}%s)
{?hero_names}%s embarked to settle a score with the Swine, tearing down their shrines in the Warrens. ({?difficulty}%s {?length}%s)
{?hero_names}%s set off on a mission to stave off growing disease in the Weald. ({?difficulty}%s {?length}%s)
{?hero_names}%s set forth to purge our ancestral Ruins of the Necromancer. ({?difficulty}%s {?length}%s)
{?hero_names}%s delved deep into the Warrens, bent on destruction of the gargantuan Swine Prince. ({?difficulty}%s {?length}%s)
{?hero_names}%s embarked to the Weald, determined to hunt and slay a foul cannibalistic Hag. ({?difficulty}%s {?length}%s)
{?hero_names}%s are raiding the Shrieker's Perch in search of valuable treasures!
{?hero_names}%s took the first steps into the Darkest Dungeon. ({?difficulty}%s {?length}%s)
{?hero_names}%s entered the belly of the beast. ({?difficulty}%s {?length}%s)
{?hero_names}%s left to find and scuttle the Brigand's Cannon. ({?difficulty}%s {?length}%s)
{?hero_names}%s left to find and scuttle the Brigand's Cannon. ({?difficulty}%s {?length}%s)
{?hero_names}%s left to find and scuttle the Brigand's Cannon. ({?difficulty}%s {?length}%s)
{?hero_names}%s set sail to strike a final bargain with the Drowned Crew. ({?difficulty}%s {?length}%s)
{?hero_names}%s set sail to strike a final bargain with the Drowned Crew. ({?difficulty}%s {?length}%s)
{?hero_names}%s set sail to strike a final bargain with the Drowned Crew. ({?difficulty}%s {?length}%s)
{?hero_names}%s embarked to put the Flesh out of its unnatural life. ({?difficulty}%s {?length}%s)
{?hero_names}%s embarked to put the Flesh out of its unnatural life. ({?difficulty}%s {?length}%s)
{?hero_names}%s embarked to put the Flesh out of its unnatural life. ({?difficulty}%s {?length}%s)

{?hero_names}%s set forth to purge our ancestral Ruins of the Necromancer. ({?difficulty}%s {?length}%s)
{?hero_names}%s set forth to purge our ancestral Ruins of the Necromancer. ({?difficulty}%s {?length}%s)
{?hero_names}%s set forth to purge our ancestral Ruins of the Necromancer. ({?difficulty}%s {?length}%s)
{?hero_names}%s set out to silence the Prophet. ({?difficulty}%s {?length}%s)
{?hero_names}%s set out to silence the Prophet. ({?difficulty}%s {?length}%s)
{?hero_names}%s set out to silence the Prophet. ({?difficulty}%s {?length}%s)
{?hero_names}%s set out to return the Siren to unfathomable deeps. ({?difficulty}%s {?length}%s)
{?hero_names}%s set out to return the Siren to unfathomable deeps. ({?difficulty}%s {?length}%s)
{?hero_names}%s set out to return the Siren to unfathomable deeps. ({?difficulty}%s {?length}%s)
{?hero_names}%s delved deep into the Warrens, bent on destruction of the gargantuan Swine Prince. ({?difficulty}%s {?length}%s)
{?hero_names}%s delved deep into the Warrens, bent on destruction of the gargantuan Swine Prince. ({?difficulty}%s {?length}%s)
{?hero_names}%s delved deep into the Warrens, bent on destruction of the gargantuan Swine Prince. ({?difficulty}%s {?length}%s)
deployed to stop the Brigand raiders!
Set off on the difficult climb to the Shrieker's Perch in hopes of finding lost equipment.
Set off on the difficult climb to the Shrieker's Perch in hopes of finding lost equipment.
Set off on the difficult climb to the Shrieker's Perch in hopes of finding lost equipment.
{?hero_names}%s are raiding the Shrieker's Perch to recover the purloined trinkets!
{?hero_names}%s set forth to explore the Ruins. ({?difficulty}%s {?length}%s)
Bloodmoon campaigns are not for the faint of heart. Expect no quarter, no forgiveness. You must conquer the evil within a time and hero death limit. (Bloodmoon is Stygian + Crimson Court)
Stygian campaigns are not for the faint of heart. Expect no quarter, no forgiveness. You must conquer the evil within a time and hero death limit. Also, many gameplay settings are locked.
Radiant campaigns, while still challenging, are adjusted to be faster and more forgiving than normal. Suggested for your first Darkest Dungeon experience.
You need at least 1 hero to venture on. This one cannot be dismissed just yet.
This will dismiss the hero permanently. Are you sure you want to dismiss this hero?
You will no longer have 4 compatible heroes to venture on with if you dismiss this hero. Are you sure you want to dismiss this hero?
{colour_start|notable}%s{colour_end} survived a successful quest in the Darkest Dungeon.
{colour_start|notable}%s{colour_end} dealt the final blow to slay the Heart of Darkness!
A coarse, time-worn weaving bearing invocations of unutterable alienage.
A minor collectible, worth money in bunches.
The shard of a wooden bench said to once hold followers of the Prophet!
The colors shift and change with the light...
Gold greases palms, builds empires, and instigates murder.
A simple necklace fashioned out of bronze.
Eat to restore health and stave off hunger. Each party member generally consumes 1 unit per meal.
Though painted a hundred years ago, the resemblance to you is uncanny.
Some things are better left unopened.
A terribly strong concoction to counter the effects of disease and infection.
The left hand of some malefactor who died on the gallows, made into a candle with the man's own fat.
It emits an otherworldly luminescence, used to light Protective Wards.
A bag of precious unspoiled grain.
A surviving trophy from a past holy war.
Used to purify the corrupted altars.
Powerful medicines... worth more than gold to a beleaguered Hamlet.
An implement for hard labor and occasional destruction.
Useful for crossing hazards and various other things.
Use to counter blights, poisons, and toxins.
Use to stanch the flow of bleeding.
Greatly increases the hound's vigor for a short time.
Use to camp. Make sure to have enough food for the meal phase or heroes will starve!
A soothing tincture to inure one's mind against the horrors of the dark.
Use to cross hazards and secure items.
Use to clear obstacles and break into things.
Use to unlock strongboxes and doors.
Select a destination room on the map.
You aren't allowed to have two of the same trinket on a hero.
A crude jumble of stones and debris blocks the path.
An ancient vessel blocks the path.
Gnarled limbs and spiked branches block the path.
The Hamlet crumbles! An impasse of freshly fallen stone & splintered wooden beams.
At least it's something to remember them by...
%s met their final fate during the quest.
%s died ensuring others could escape from the Darkest Dungeon.
%s died ensuring the Bandit raiders were delayed.
The Shrieker's call is almost unbearable to human ears.
Crows are fickle things - defeat this ghastly nuisance before it flees!
Survivors of this encounter are sometimes rewarded with unique Quirks!
Rapturous Cultists will give their lives to protect their allies!
The protective Talismans will only shield those who equip them...beware the Templars!
Prepare yourself for the longest, most gruelling quest of your campaign.
The Vvulf has rallied his men! Push through the Brigand hordes, defeat him, and restore some semblance of safety to the Hamlet!
The Shrieker's call is almost unbearable to human ears.
Crows are fickle things - defeat this ghastly nuisance before it flees!
Survivors of this encounter are sometimes rewarded with unique Quirks!
Your first expedition into the ruins of your ancestry. Be curious, be careful.
I'm never going back to that place.
I've seen enough of the Darkest Dungeon to last a lifetime.
The geometry of the place...it was all wrong!
Are you sure you want to delete this save?
This version of DARKEST DUNGEON has been created specifically for demonstration purposes. Saving is disabled. Purchase the full version on the Mac App Store!
BRIGHT LIGHT Mildly increased Stress Damage, Monster Attack, Loot, Player Crit
DIM LIGHT Increased Stress Damage, Monster Attack, Loot, Player Crit
SHADOWY Strongly increased Stress Damage, Monster Attack, Loot, Player Crit
DARKNESS Greatly increased Stress Damage, Monster Attack, Loot, Player Crit
{colour_start|town_activity_log_building_name}{?building_name}%s:{colour_end} {colour_start|notable}{?hero_name}%s{colour_end} underwent effective quirk treatment. Quirk Removed: {?quirk_name}%s
{colour_start|town_activity_log_building_name}{?building_name}%s:{colour_end} {colour_start|notable}{?hero_name}%s{colour_end} underwent effective quirk treatment. Quirk Removed: {?quirk_name}%s
{?survivor}%s successfully escorted you to the Hamlet, but {?fallen_hero}%s met his end on the Old Road.
{?hero_names}%s successfully escorted you to the Hamlet.
{?hero_names}%s perished on the Old Road, but you escaped through the trees and made it to the Hamlet.
Eat nothing, take %d%% damage plus stress damage
The exertions of adventuring have produced a growing hunger amongst the party.

You don't have four heroes available for a quest.
You will need to recruit more heroes at the Ferry or remove some heroes from treatment.
...the recently recovered cache has excited local enthusiasts, and drawn the attention of experts in the neighboring regions.
Quiet and reserved, these men are professionals, compelled not by the scent of blood, but rather the gleam of gold.
...inexplicably however, only two have arrived. It appears that the Abbot's earnest appeal has been answered, albeit with mocking cruelty.
Debaucherous and decadent in the extreme, several nomadic warriors have wandered into the Hamlet in search of a glorious death. We can only hope they find it quickly.
One cannot help but admire these unfortunate souls - they bear their burden with a grace and humility seldom seen in the able-bodied.
While strange utterances and unsettling chants typically characterize such events, we have been assured there is no real danger present in the rituals themselves.
The Sisters of St. Martha's will lead the service with a chorus of 'We Are the Flame', after which they will be accepting confessions in the lower hall.
By hateful curse or malign miracle, it seems even death may be defied in this damnable place. Only ONE of these soldiers can be returned to the living...
Despondency and ambivalence seem to be on the wind. Many adventurers confess to having a troubled disposition, even here, in the relative safety of the Hamlet
Superstitious mariners rejoiced earlier today at news that unspeakable eldritch evils no longer threaten their cargo.
Reports from the hill cottages confirm a welcome reduction in the general aire of malaise in and around the old Ruins.
They were a fearsome lot - gritted teeth, distant stares; and between them, an unbreakable bond of fellowship.
West side residents have expressed relief at the abatement of the nauseating odour emanating from the ancient aqueducts.
Wholesome plant life has been spotted in the surrounding wood - a rarity in these parts.
The Abbey will be decorated for the duration of the event, and all are welcome to visit during the extended hours.
The town is alight with a spirit of goodwill and revelry, but this life-affirming attitude is not predicted to last long.
The time and gold were not spent in vain, however, as today caregivers announced they have succeeded in concocting an effective antidote.
Among the visiting delegation are experts in corporeal and cognitive disability, as well as several forensic specialists.
The Tavern will be open later than normal throughout the celebration, and residents are asked to maintain some semblance of decorum when leaving after midnight.
...and it is during such lunar phases that many residents report shrieks and howls of the most profoundly unnerving quality.
The keenest eye and steadiest hand will prevail during this week's tournament. The winner will claim the coveted Caretaker's Cup.
Most curious of all, however, is the absence of any evidence in the crypt itself. Nevertheless, the chest was found open, its contents conspicuously missing.
In the ensuing melee, two of the men escaped the scene and are said to be at large. They are most assuredly armed, dangerous, and desperate.
Threats to our collective safety are never in short supply, but this week our local constabulary received a welcome augmentation...
The music itself is damnably familiar, and yet, strangely unplaceable. Is it the instrument's odd tuning, or some inhuman quality in the bard's fingers?
The veteran Sergeant will be demonstrating his training regimen at the Guild Hall every night for the next week. All those concerned with self-preservation are encouraged to attend.
The shadow of sickness and disease has cast itself upon our Hamlet, and with it - panic.
...and while the campaign continues to drag on, recent events have emboldened the standing roster. Confidence is reported to be at an all-time high.
This pleasant weather comes as a welcome change, particularly for those currently enjoying a period of convalescence.
...as one man put it, Somethin' ain't right with them shadows - movin' and twistin' as they do.". Residents are advised to stay indoors until daybreak."
Ironically, those most vocal concerning the current dearth of spirits and mead are the same patrons whose unrestrained exuberance the night before exhausted the supply.
Bedsheets and pillowcases gleam white on the line, their lascivious history easily erased, unlike the consciences of those who sullied them.
The Abbot will not comment on the condition of the Penance Hall at this time, except to say that he expects normal operations to be resumed shortly.
Operations will be suspended temporarily, but given the limited avenues of egress from the Hamlet, officials are optimistic the thieves will be apprehended shortly.
Indeed, the elements have not been kind to the old Abbey; the very soil itself seems to reject the place. Work is expected to last through the week.
The Abbot has sequestered himself in the wine cellar, ostensibly to consider how best to help his parisioners cope with the deluge of godless horrors that plague these lands.
The collection is indeed impressive, and all the more appealing when one takes notice of the discounted prices.
Stunned by the apparent value of the thing concealed amidst its putrid feathers, onlookers wondered if a trek to its perch might not be in order...
To arms! A Brigand raiding party is descending upon the Hamlet with explosive fury and murderous intent!
Yet another cargo vessel has sunk off the coast, and the surviving crew have proven distressingly evasive concerning the particulars of this latest nautical nightmare.
Met at the bridge by a jubilant crowd, the Caretaker credits a thick fog and an early departure time for the wagon's safe arrival.
Nearby farmers have banded together, increasing security in an effort to protect the healthy livestock and crops upon which the Hamlet depends.
Putting ego aside does not come easily to such seasoned survivors, but the new recruits are palpably grateful for the assistance.
In the end, however, the damnable thing managed to get away with its prize; the Hamlet's coffers all the poorer for having hosted the unwanted guest.
He stayed up working for days, inspired by the rare quality of his materials, and determined to do them justice with his own skill.
Historically, seasonal labourers have been loath to make the journey along the Old Road, but harsh economic conditions have driven them to desperation.
In the end, the hours of rooting through the old barrels and forgotten weapon racks bore fruit!
The Shrieker has stolen %d of your trinkets!
All Stress Relief Activities More Effective
All Stress Relief Activities Less Effective
Level Restrictions Removed for Next Quest
Your party is not fully outfitted with trinkets. Really embark?
You haven't purchased much food for your expedition. It's recommended to take at least %d food for this quest. Still Embark?
A fish on two legs? Test the strength of this new menace.
Unholy abominations turning the Light against itself. Meet them in battle and learn how they fight.
An exploratory sortie into a mad realm of tunnels. Meet the enemy in battle, and then fade to safety with newfound information.
Beat back the creatures and bandits that endanger traffic on the Old Road.
Take the fight to the waters and show them our landward strength.
They can be killed. They can be beaten.
They can be killed. They can be beaten. Starting now.
Infection spreads unless checked. Put a tourniquet on the festering wood by destroying any creature you encounter.
This aquatic cult respects nothing but force. Leave a trail of scales and gills and let them dwell on that.
There are times for strategy, and times for brute force. Send the undead back to the hells from which they were summoned. All of them.
The swinefolk are growing in strength and numbers. Cut them like diseased wheat.
Endless winding paths all arive at the same place: the enemy. Bring war to the Weald.
Scout the unwholesome rocky formations beneath the Manor for signs of life.
Test yourself in the mad realm of your fallen ancestor. Take note of how the creatures have taken over, but don't delve too far.
The beast-men spill forth from a thousand gaping holes. Pick one and search its extents.
Take the Old Road into the wood and then pick any of the dozens of dark paths. Test that path and then return with your heads intact.
Plunge into forgotten grottos and assess the cancerous extent of the fishfolk's domain.
Unholy machinations have crushed together hallway and vault. Explore your ancestral home as far as you are able.
Explore the Warrens. With a better understanding of where the creatures are coming from, future raids can target their sources of power.
The Old Road is obscured by the corrupted, poisoned overgrowth. Explore and return with a full description of every side path you visit.
Follow every cavern and grotto to its conclusion and discover from whence the malign currents flow.
Is an apocalypse building? Cinch your packs and delve far, far into the tunnels of your fallen family. Make a map of your expedition.
Gain entry to the network of tunnels and take them to every possible extent you can manage. Return with a complete map.
The Weald was nearly inscrutable even before the corruption. Now it is nothing but dark mystery. Provision well and mount an expedition to map as much ground as you can.
Your Ancestor was receiving eldritch relics via marine shipments. Find and return them to town where they can be stored safely out of the hands of greater evils.
When the Estate was overrun, so too were many treasures and symbols of the Light. The Abbot will pay dearly for such relics.
The swine's appetite for comestibles exceeds even their thirst for blood. Winter is always close, and the Hamlet would do well to restock its sparse larder.
Many a cart-driver has met their end while traversing the Weald. A king's ransom of medicines was recently abandoned. They would greatly assist in rebuilding this sickly hamlet.
The power of the fishfolk grows with every moon! Light the ancient wards, and drain some of the natural power that they draw upon.
The unholy abominations inhabiting the crumbling house have turned beacons of Light into vessels for diabolical worship. Cleanse these altars with Consecrated Essence and bring back the Light.
The beast-men have erected crude and dirty shrines to their pagan Gods. Knock them down with pick-axe and might and impede their worship!
Blighted corpses lay strewn about the Old Road, teeming with filth and disease. Journeys to and from the Hamlet pose constant threat of sickness. Destroy this blight with Potent Salve.
A Necromancer is performing unspeakable rituals in the shattered halls of your ancestral home. It must be stopped.
Deep within the shattered vaults of your ancestral home, a Necromancer is performing unspeakable rituals… even raising the dead! It must be stopped.
Stunned by the apparent value of the thing concealed amidst its putrid feathers, onlookers wondered if a trek to its perch might not be in order...
The creature's power waxes terrible. Recover the protective relics from the long-abandoned base camp, but beware the Shuffling Horror.
The creature's gestation must be interrupted! Overwhelm the defending force and illuminate the beacons - force the Thing to reveal itself prematurely!
Your enemy is vast, sprawling, and must be destroyed from within. Slog through the twisting maze and find your way to its throbbing heart.
At last, the twisted heart of the world is laid bare – for sword, or supplication.
As long as the thieves and ruffians man a cannon on the Old Road, the Hamlet will be cut off from trade. Demolish this ironwork devil!
As long as the thieves and ruffians man a cannon on the Old Road, the Hamlet will be cut off from trade. Demolish this ironwork devil!
As long as the thieves and ruffians man a cannon on the Old Road, the Hamlet will be cut off from trade. Demolish this ironwork devil!
The vengeful wraiths threaten to drag all we've built down into their domain of darkness. Give them a sailor's death - once and for all!
The vengeful wraiths threaten to drag all we've built down into their domain of darkness. Give them a sailor's death - once and for all!

Some things were never meant to live. Cleanse the sin of the Ancestor's experimentations and put this abomination into the abyss where it belongs.

Snapped bones and tanned human hides are the spoor of a vile cannibalistic hag. For all that is good, destroy her.

A Necromancer is performing unspeakable rituals in the shattered halls of your ancestral home… it must be stopped.

Raving madman, doom bearer, apocalyptic herald. Whatever his role, there is a sickness in his wild sermons that must be silenced. Dispose of this "Prophet."

Haunting melodies and otherworldy bass notes echo from the cliffs beneath the Manor. Discover the source...and silence it.

A broken adventurer tells of a beast so unspeakable and terrible that the swinefolk have made it their Lord. Perhaps it is only rumor and shadow, but this threat cannot be left to fester.

To arms! A Brigand raiding party is descending upon the Hamlet with explosive fury, and murderous intent!
It scours the land, picking up the trinkets left by dead heroes and hoarding them in its rotting nest.
It scours the land, picking up the trinkets left by dead heroes and hoarding them in its rotting nest.

Test yourself in the mad realm of your fallen ancestor. Take note of how the creatures have taken over, but don't delve too far.
Enter this, the most dreaded of regions.
Find your way to the Hamlet...
Explore other regions to unlock this one.

You can not retreat from this quest. Are you sure you want to proceed?
If a Darkest Dungeon quest is abandoned, not all heroes are guaranteed to survive. Someone must sacrifice themselves to hold off the fiends during retreat.
Some of your heroes need their camping skills equipped.
Some of your heroes do not have all of their combat skills equipped.
Grave danger awaits the underprepared. Do you wish to continue without a full contingent?
You should equip the following trinkets before embarking, or failure is nearly certain:
By ignoring the Brigand Incursion event, you are allowing your Hamlet to be razed! Several building upgrades will be destroyed as Vvulf and his men mercilessly pillage the township.
You must battle the merciless Brigands amidst crumbling buildings and rampant structure fires - this is not an easy task. Retreating will result in the death of one of your heroes.
The next blow could be fatal!
Attracts enemies and takes more damage from some attacks.
Takes extra damage from some hero attacks.
An unusual meal, but a meal nonetheless!
Whatever awaits, it cannot be worse than what I've endured.
So I'm the final antique, yet nothing will be around to collect...
Please, no! I want to live!
Unholy foulness! I will take you with me!
A proper lady does not volunteer herself for slaughter!
Send me to hell then! AAAKYLORAAAHHH!
No way out. hmph. Let's do this.
Steady, girl. If we're called, we answer.
Hah! The joke's on me then...?
Spare the others, I am ready.
I go with a clear conscience. I've given my all.
All for one, and one for all!
Finally, the face of my tormentor. Come, then.
Not me! I am a learned scholar!
Required DLC is missing. Continue? (This will remove DLC content from your save, and is not reversible.)
UI overlay that gives icon hints to remind you of what items have worked on curios in the past.
Cannot be hit by attacks targeting only this slot.

Monsters with {colour_start|stealth}STEALTH{colour_end} have a shadowy appearance and cannot be hit by direct attacks, but are vulnerable to area of effect attacks. Additionally, some hero skills, such as the Shieldbreaker's "Expose", can hit them while in {colour_start|stealth}stealth{colour_end}. These skills have the additional benefit of {colour_start|stealth}de-stealthing{colour_end} the monster.
We need to finish this fight quickly!
If we tarry, surely more will come!
Do not toy with this one! It may signal for more.
Let us be done with this rabble!

Interested in the latest official news and offers about Darkest Dungeon and Red Hook Studios? Please join the mailing list!
We don't spam, and will never share your email address with third parties. Joining the list helps support us by letting us reach gamers like you directly!

A brutally efficient single-target executioner and crowd control specialist. For the Bounty Hunter, planning is key - mark targets for bonus damage or look for opportunties to capitalize on a stunned foe. He can also wreak havoc on an enemy party's order using his grappling hook, flashbangs and powerful uppercut.

Battle-hardened and stalwart, the Crusader has held the front lines in a hundred holy wars. He either attacks foes head-on with righteous fury, or embraces a melee support role by leveraging his powerful defensive buffs & off-heals.

The Grave Robber is a versatile and nimble combatant, moving back and forth through the ranks with ease. She strikes without warning and retreats to the shadows, continuing her assault at range. If her throwing daggers and poison darts aren't getting the job done, she can return to the melee, buffed and slinging her pickaxe!

Wild, unpredictable, and utterly ruthless, the Hellion thrills to the spilling of blood! Her massive glaive affords her impressive reach in combat, while its razor sharp edge leaves lasting wounds on enemies. Certain skills leave her exhausted, however, and she may occasionally need to take a turn to recharge her adrenaline before entering the fray once again.

A rogue, a thug and a thief, the Highwayman has honed his skills with dirk and flintlock to devastating effect. Whether at range or in a melee, he is equally effective at dispatching his foes. Be it a grapeshot area-of-effect, or single target bleed, the Highwayman's skills focus solely on dealing damage in a variety of ways.

A lifetime of scholarly inquest into ancient and forbidden lore has opened the Occultist's mind to the powers of the void. Debilitating curses and maddeningly impossible support skills are his specialty. The void, however, is an unpredictable power, and consequently skills' effectiveness can vary dramatically, and usually come at a cost of light, or stress.

A doctor, researcher and alchemist who prefers to hang back, eating away at her foes with stacking damage-over-time abilties like toxic clouds & plague-filled grenades. She is equally effective in a support role, blinding and confusing foes while enhancing a party's survival with damage-increasing tonics, and remedies for bleed and blight effects.

The warrior nun channels her zeal for battle into healing abilities, holy judgements and dazzling explosions of light. A strong backbone to any party, the Vestal can also hold her own on the front line with a powerful mace bash and close-quarters condemnations.

Combat is a power-ballad - a slow build up, and a grand finale! On the offense, the Jester leaps to and fro in a bloody cacophony, positioning himself for a glorious end in the front ranks! Alternatively, he can hang back, delivering chilling melodies and unsettling riffs that terrorize his foes, and give strength to his allies.

A ruined man, a warrior, and a poet. The Leper is most effective when given a turn to focus himself before raising his massive blade. When he swings, it is all or nothing - crushing blows and massive damage or the empty whistling of a glancing blow. He is entirely self-sufficient, drawing strength from his life of trauma, and able to channel it into heals, protection, or unrelenting fury.

A runaway turned soldier, the Arbalest is the definitive backline fighter. Able to rain suppressing fire down on the enemy, snipe high profile targets and apply powerfully effective first-aid, she is a rallying point, a turret, a beacon in the dark.

The Man-at-Arms is a seasoned veteran of combat, and has been rewarded for his toil with haunting guilt and stoic resilience in equal measure. Immovable, commanding, and focused, the Man-at-Arms breaks down enemy lines with his mace, buckler, and furious battle cries.

A tough and uncommonly compassionate ex-lawman, the Houndmaster and his faithful Wolfhound work in tandem to bring down their enemies and protect the innocent. Together they stalk the back ranks, bursting forth in a flurry of harrying bleeds, gnashing teeth, and stunning blows. Should the tide of battle turn, the pair can support an ailing party by protecting the weak, and rallying the stressed.

Beaten, branded and imprisoned for untold decades, this furtive vagrant hides a terrible secret. The eldritch poison coursing through his veins has given him unspeakable power, at a terrible cost. As his form changes, so too does his role in combat!

A scholar, researcher, and keen archaeologist, The Antiquarian is not well suited for combat. She is, however, an expert in self-preservation - by making herself scarce in a fight, or demanding an ally protect her, she ensures her survival. If direct combat is unavoidable, The Antiquarian can use her fulminating censer to heal and invigorate allies... and to toxify attackers.

A competitive sharpshooter with little practical experience, the Musketeer excels when enemies remain at a distance. Her unerring eye and practiced reloading makes her a dependable damage dealer, and her smokescreen, first aid, and skeet shot provide some supportive utility to the party.

The Bounty Hunter favors a hand-axe and grappling hook, a pairing that allows him to ensnare and execute his quarry with professional efficiency. His tough leather and scale armor grants decent protection, without sacrificing mobility.

The Crusader wears heavy plate mail and wields a longsword. While affording him excellent protection and damage, his armor restricts movement, and his sword cannot be swung effectively in the back ranks.
A light coat is all the Graverobber will wear, she favours mobility and dexterity over protection. Concealed within her garment are razor sharp throwing daggers, and buckled to her back - a pickaxe!

Crude leather and furs may offer little protection, but the Hellion lives to bear the scars of battle proudly. Her priority is wreaking havoc with her massive glaive and bathing in the blood of her adversaries.

The Highwayman's reinforced overcoat will dull a knife-strike, but he relies more on evasion than damage mitigation. His flintlock and short sword afford him great versatility; he is never out of position, or caught unawares.

Scholarly robes, better suited to the library than the harsh realities of adventuring, are all the Occultist has brought with him. His rituals and chants require deft movements of hand and finger, so better he be unencumbered that he may channel the power of his morbid fetish: the polished skull of a dead man.
The Plague Doctor wears only light cloth - intent on remaining as far from melee combat as possible. From a distance she lobs toxic sachets that can blind, disorient, and eat away at her foes.

Blessed plate mail encases the Vestal as she delivers terrible violence and healing comfort in equal measure. A mace in one hand, and holy book in the other - a study in contrasts, and all the more effective for it!
Clad only in mildewed cloth, the Jester makes a mockery of battle. Only a fool would underestimate the vicious bloodletting power of his sharpened sickle, or the discordant throng of his lute.
Heavy and restricting, the Leper's bronzed cuirass can absorb all manner of punishing blow. His massive sword is slow to swing, but delivers crushing damage to anyone caught in its unstoppable arc.

The Arbalest takes her name from the massive crossbow she carries into battle. Able to decimate enemies at range with a dizzying array of ammunition, she wears medium plate for increased protection against the volleys she knows are coming...
Clad in the heaviest plate, the Man-at-Arms is a mace-wielding wrecking ball! Quick to react and adapt, he is most effective leading the charge, protecting his companions with his unbreakable shield.

Still clad in his worn Gendarme's uniform, the Houndmaster's focus is on evasion over mitigation. His cudgel is an effecive stunning tool, but it is the Hound who delivers the pair's most crippling blows, especially when he's been fed an invigorating snack!

Protected by cursed chains and a thick, leathery hide, the Abomination can withstand the pressures of frontline combat as well as any plated footman. His terrible claws are each the size of daggers, and his progressive mutation manifests in unspeakable strength, speed, and a profusion of bile.

The Antiquarian wears no armor to speak of, instead relying on the power of the innumerable ancient charms and relics she has collected in her travels. Her eye for rarities is enhanced by the unsettling properties of her censer's vapours, which can offer some utility to the party in ...problematic encounters.

Although outwardly inconspicuous, the Musketeer's regalia is reinforced with hardened leather underarmor, allowing her to sustain a considerable amount of focus fire. Her Musket's variable ammunition and trusty sidearm allow her to deal debilitating damage at range.

Righteousness and conviction inspire compelling speeches around the campfire! In the face of mounting stress, the Crusader is a leader, standing tall and refusing to break. His unshakable belief can assuage companions' fears, reassuring them that despite the hardships they will most certainly endure, all will be well in the end.

The Grave Robber is restless, and prefers to wander while the party camps, always on the lookout for trinkets and baubles. She may reluctantly confess to pilfering an item in the Hamlet prior to departure, or entertain those with a similarly morbid sense of humour with a biting and ironic wit.

At camp, the Hellion mutters blasphemies and sharpens her blade, eager to put it to use against the enemy hordes. Raucous and untamed, she is a study in contrasts - sitting stoically preparing for battle, or pealing with the unhinged laughter of the damned.

The Highwayman relishes cynical preparedness and off-color jokes around the campfire. A life spent running and hiding has taught him the tenuous benefit of perimeter alarms, and late-night investigations into the encroaching shadows.

At rest, the Occultist will attempt communion with the dark and impossible forces of the void in an effort to strengthen himself and the party. Such efforts are frequently taxing, however, exacting a toll in darkness and stress.

The Plague Doctor makes use of experimental remedies and risky healing practices to cure her companions' ailments, and restore their vigor. Eager to prove the effectiveness of her latest untested concotion, she will inject herself - blindly faithful in its beneficial results.

Prayers, chants, and blessings bring peace and solace to the Vestal and her party. She can improve a companion's combat prowess, or instead focus on reducing the group's stress, and making the campsite a safe place for a good night's rest.

A loner and an outcast, the Leper will tend to shun the others in his group, preferring instead to mend his own dying body at the expense of the horror such an undertaking brings forth. In order to reduce his stress, the Leper can remove his mask, but such a thing is sure to unsettle his companions.

The Jester shines in the flickering light of the campfire, bringing his lute and unerring wit to bear against the fears and stress his companions suffer. He can inspire greater combat prowess, or raise the group's spirits at the cost of singling out a target for his acrimonious scandalizing.

As on the battlefield, so too at camp. The Arbalest splits her time at rest, providing expert first aid care, and preparing for the next leg of the journey with optimized marching plans and a fresh, taut bowstring.

The Man-at-Arms seeks to either practice his strict training regimen himself, or teach it to his companions. Dexterity, damage and unerring accuracy await those fortified enough to endure his lessons.

A clever lawman knows the value of preparedness and information. To this end, the Houndmaster can send his Wolfhound to scout ahead, or put him on watch to ensure a good night's rest. If spirits are low, the dog's affectionate companionship can soften the heart, and ease the mind.

The Abomination spends his restful moments lost in the myriad symptoms of his condition. Pulse-pounding self-buffs provide opportunities for even greater effectiveness in the next melee, while concentrating on suppressing his terrible impulses can alleviate some of the party's apprehension.

A researcher never rests! The Antiquarian surveys the campsite, obtaining supply items and even trinkets that the party may have overlooked. Her peculiar utterances and strange powders have been known to put minds at ease, and strengthen corporeal hardiness.

The Musketeer understands that her's is a delicate instrument, and must be properly maintained if it to be relied upon in the heat of battle! She is equally adept and providing first aid to her companions, if only to keep them between her and her targets.

A sandstorm of grace and fury, the Shieldbreaker dances through the ranks delivering precision strikes of remarkable power. Sundering armor, breaking enemy formations, and leaving the taste of venom wherever she goes, the Shieldbreaker is a remorseless combatant.

The Shieldbreaker wields a spear and buckler, affording her impressive offensive reach and a modicum of protection. Her dancer's garb is better suited to the stage than the dungeon; she must be quick on her feet to survive.

The Flagellant relishes the scars and abrasions that cover his body - drawing incomprehensible resilience from the tearing of his own flesh. His flail, a particularly cruel and merciless weapon, drips with his enemies' blood...and his own.

Eschewing the company of others, the Flagellant turns his back to the fire, denying himself the comfort of its warmth. Instead, he whips himself mercilessly - this a man locked in perpetual battle with his own flesh and blood.

The Flagellant belongs to an extremist faction within the church, and is generally regarded with a toxic mixture of fear, awe, and disgust. The power he draws from martyrdom is as effective as it is unsettling - in one moment he is a fountain of healing renewal, and the next, a conduit of terrible wrath. His full potential is realized only the brink of madness...or death.
